alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 06 at 3:06AM AKST until December 07 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will continue into early Thursday. The worst conditions are expected this afternoon and evening when south winds gust to 45 mph. Visibility could briefly drop to less than one quarter mile this afternoon. Conditions will improve early Thursday as winds decrease.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
